stuy
Class OperatorInterface

java.lang.Object
  stuy.OperatorInterface
All Implemented Interfaces:
Constants
public class OperatorInterface
extends java.lang.Object
implements Constants

Handles input from the operator interface using the Cypress FirstTouch I/O module.

Author:
Kevin Wang

Constructor Detail

OperatorInterface

public OperatorInterface()
Operator interface constructor, setting digital inputs pulled up.

Method Detail

setStuffsBrokenLED

public void setStuffsBrokenLED(boolean val)
Sets the error light. True turns it on.

getAutonSetting

public int getAutonSetting()
Use a thumbwheel switch to set the autonomous mode setting. Because the switch begins at 0 (January), 1 is added to the switch value to get the auton setting number.

Returns:
Autonomous setting to run.

getHeightButton

public int getHeightButton()
Determines which height button is pressed. All eleven (8 logically because side buttons are wired together) arm height buttons are wired by means of resistors to one analog input. Depending on the button that is pressed, a different voltage is read by the analog input. Each resistor reduces the voltage by about 1/8 the maximum voltage.

Returns:
An integer value representing the height button that was pressed.

getRawAnalogVoltage

public double getRawAnalogVoltage()
Gets the voltage read by the arm height button analog input.

Returns:
The voltage of the arm height button analog input.

isHeightButtonPressed

public boolean isHeightButtonPressed()
Check if a height button is being pressed.

Returns:
True if a height button is being pressed.

getMinibotSwitch

public boolean getMinibotSwitch()
Checks the state of the minibot switch.

Returns:
True if pressed.

getWingSwitch

public boolean getWingSwitch()
Checks the state of the wing switch.

Returns:
True if pressed.

getExtraButton

public boolean getExtraButton()
Checks the state of the extra button.

Returns:
True if pressed.

getTrimAmount

public double getTrimAmount(double maxTrim)
Maps the position of the trim potentiometer to a range between -maxTrim and maxTrim for adjusting the arm position control setpoint.

Parameters:
maxTrim - The range of arm pot voltage that the trim pot affects.
Returns:
0 if the trim pot is in the center position. Otherwise, -maxTrim to maxTrim.

setLight

public void setLight(int lightNum)
Sets the button light to turn on. Button lights on the OI are controlled by 5 digital outputs; four for binary, and one to enable/disable the lights. These light numbers are defined in Constants.

Parameters:
lightNum - The number of the light to turn on.

lightsOff

public void lightsOff()
Outputs high on the disable bit to turn off all button lights.

getMaxVoltage

public double getMaxVoltage()
Reads the value of an analog input wired directly from the 3.3v pin. This is effectively the voltage read by the Cypress board which is being sent out of the 3.3v pin. Math is done on this voltage to determine height buttons and the trim pot mapping.

Returns:
The voltage of the Cypress board.
